name: places/ChIJ7SdSPrpYwokRb0fNgN44F4g
formattedAddress: 407 E 85th St, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 407 E 85th St, New York, NY 10028-6368, USA

originalText.text:
I've known Dr. Susan Budney in various professional capacities for well over a decade. I'd also known people who'd been her patients in the past and they'd shared positive feedback about her sensitivity, clinical knowledge, work-ethics, and commitment to clients' well being.
She specializes in working with trauma (including with people with extensive and prolonged trauma histories), and demonstrates understanding of the complexities of trauma work and the need for careful consideration and safe boundaries around the tricky inter-relational issues those can bring up.

text.text:
I've known Dr. Susan Budney in various professional capacities for well over a decade. I'd also known people who'd been her patients in the past and they'd shared positive feedback about her sensitivity, clinical knowledge, work-ethics, and commitment to clients' well being.
She specializes in working with trauma (including with people with extensive and prolonged trauma histories), and demonstrates understanding of the complexities of trauma work and the need for careful consideration and safe boundaries around the tricky inter-relational issues those can bring up.

originalText.text:
I wish there had been more information/patient reviews available to me prior to my meeting with this therapist, thus the purpose of my review. If you have a history of abuse or trauma, I would recommend thinking twice before contacting Dr. Budney. From my experience, initially she came off as caring/empathetic/sincere, but I felt red flags that no one is really that sincere- it was too extreme, that it felt inauthentic. I went against my better instincts, but later found the truth- that she does not care, that she is not reliable, that she lies and fails to follow-through on her promises. To me, she is not safe. I wish I hadn't ever met with her as my experience with her makes it even harder for me to try and trust a new therapist- she added to the trauma that I was already experiencing.

One additional note, she works out of a studio apartment- so there is no waiting room. I think it's typical to show up to an appointment at least 5-10 minutes early to make sure you are not late (and especially because you are paying so much), but there is absolutely no place for you to wait. I would try to time it so that I would get there as close to the time of my appointment as possible.  Even when I arrived 2 minutes early once, she let me in and asked me to get settled, but commented that I was early. Another time when I arrived slightly early (maybe 5-10 minutes before my scheduled time) she was with another patient. It's currently winter and I had nowhere to stand except in the entryway to the apartment building with residents needing to pass by me- it was awkward and uncomfortable.

I hope this review is helpful for others. I feel that I wasted thousands of dollars.

originalText.text: Dr. Susan Budney is an excellent therapist. A true professional with a great attitude. Recommend her 100%.
